1141111111112112211112111221111112211111.content:
Melissa’s mother was convinced by her daughter’s lie. She tossed you to Melissa, who caught you by your strap. Her mother said, “I’ve decided to let you keep him on the condition that you never let him have his humanity back. He’s a little monster that preys on innocent girls and women. This is certainly better than turning him into the police.” Melissa nodded back to her mother. “Oh yes, yes it is. Certainly.” Outwardly, Melissa was projecting a look of seriousness and concerned sympathy for your non-existent victims. Inwardly, you were certain that she was laughing evilly. Melissa was a master at manipulating emotions.

“Oh, and Melissa! I don’t want you to refer to that thing as a human anymore! Got it?” her mother called after her as she ran back upstairs while clutching you tightly to her chest. Once she reached the top of the stairs, she yelled back, “Ok Mom!” Lowering her voice, she spoke to you directly. “Hear that purse? You’re no longer human. And you’re mine to do with as I please.” You despaired. With Melissa’s mother in on the secret, there was no hope of you escaping while at home. You were also certain that Melissa would be extremely careful with you in public, especially after your attempted escape today.

Melissa’s demeanor was disturbingly calm as she informed you of your punishment. “Ok purse, here’s what’s going to happen. For this little stunt you’re not getting any water for at least a week, maybe longer if I feel like it.” Her voice was as smooth as ice, with barely any hint of emotion in it. “I’m also going to make extensive use of you during this time. If you move even one bit, or try to call out to someone, I will simply let you die of dehydration. You know, assuming you don’t die sometime this week.”

She placed you on her bed and opened you up to transfer her belongings back into you. You remained completely silent and still while she did this. After she was finished, she commented, “Good. You’re getting the hang of this already.” With that, she hung you on her door handle and ignored you the rest of the night. Once she had gone to bed and you were sure she was asleep, you tried moving around a bit. Despite your earlier successes, the exhaustion from the torture Melissa’s mother put you through and the extra weight of all of Melissa’s things inside you left you unable to do more than barely twitch.

Over the next week, Melissa kept true to her word. She did not give you any water, nor did she really even acknowledge you. She took you everywhere, always making sure you were zipped shut unless she was digging around inside you for something. After a few days you were parched, and towards the end of the week you were barely able to stay awake. You constantly passed in and out of consciousness, and during the few moments you could think straight, you were pretty sure you were going to die. The rest of the time, you had delirious thoughts about being stuck as a purse. Perhaps you were always a purse. Did purses even think? Did it even matter?

On the seventh day of your long torture, Melissa finally acknowledged you again. You didn’t remember what she said. All you could remember was her pouring water into you once again. She was generous, giving you an entire cup of water. When she picked you up, you remember her remarking “Eww… You better not get anything wet!” after hearing the water slosh around inside you. Over the next few days you slowly recovered from the extreme dehydration and recovered your sanity.

After she was certain you were recovered, Melissa explained the new state of affairs to you: “From now on, you’re no longer a human. You’re my possession. You have no name, and you will respond to and identify as whatever form I decide you should be in. You will respond only when I speak to you. You will only move when I tell you that you can move. Any violation of this will result in a punishment similar to what you just went through. Am I clear?”

Before, you were able to withstand the pain and thus stand up to Melissa. You knew that even though she could cause you severe pain, she couldn’t permanently injure or kill you. But this time, she almost ended your life. That was too much even for you. Defeated, you accepted Melissa’s term with a quiet “Yes.”

For the next six months, you were Melissa’s purse. She used you most days, carrying you everywhere. Although you were initially broken, your resolve slowly returned during this time and you kept doing your purse workouts. The leather shell you were stitched into made it difficult to accomplish any real movement, but you were definitely getting stronger. Your relationship with Melissa improved a little bit once you started acting “nice” to her, mostly out of fear for your own life. You discovered that Melissa was a control freak. If everything was going her way, she was nice to people (and purses, apparently). A few times she even struck up random conversations with you.

Now, Melissa had graduated from high school and was a freshman in college. It was late fall, and today was her birthday. Melissa was home for fall break. Earlier today she had received a present. She didn’t let you see until later that evening. It was a new black purse, fancier than her other ones and certainly fancier than you. “Oh wow, purse! Looks like I got your replacement here.” She slung the bag over her shoulder. “It certainly looks nicer. I was getting bored of you anyway. But now what to do with you?”

11411111111121122112.content:
(Author’s Note: James’ perception of Melissa is skewed by his psychological scarring. While people obviously grow and change, how much has Melissa’s personality really changed? Hint: probably not as much as James thinks.)

It had been a little over two years since that fateful day when Melissa transformed you into her personal garment. Today, you were both 20. Melissa had graduated high school and was in the fall semester of her Junior year in college as a pre-medical student. She was a member of the Epilson Kappa Kappa sorority. She also retained her job at the high-end clothing store, having transferred to their location in her university’s city. She lived off-campus with two roommates, Caitlyn and Mary, though neither of them knew the closely guarded secret about her favorite skirt.

You were declared missing a few months after Melissa abducted you, and eventually the case was dropped. You had long given up hope of being rescued, and developed a case of Stockholm syndrome to compensate. While the desire for freedom was still in the back of your mind, your damaged psyche had to rationalize the situation somehow. You began to feel proud of the fact that you made Melissa look good, especially when she complimented your “performance.” You stopped actively looking for ways to escape, instead feeling confident that the obvious opportunity would one day present itself.

You became Melissa’s go-to skirt for most business and formal occasions. She also often wore you when she just felt like dressing up for the day (which you reasoned was a good idea because you could get more education for free). Over the semesters, she had made a number of “improvements” to you that enhanced your capabilities as her captive living garment. You reflected back on the development of your relationship and what she had done to you since going to college.

In the sprint semester of sophmore year, you finally figured out how to talk even while she was sitting down. Even if it was talking into her ass and your voice was muffled, she could still understand you. This ability expanded and extended your conversations with her, as she wasn’t going to stand up just so she could talk to her skirt. You also wound up tutoring her in gen. ed. subjects many a night because of this ability. It would just be her, wearing you, sitting at a table in a common area or study room.

During her second winter semester, she accidentally injured you by slicing you on the sharp edge of a desk. You didn’t really bleed (though it was quite painful), but it did puncture you and damage your fabric lining. Melissa discovered that your form was actually slightly hollow and that she could force thin pieces of stuff inside you by shoving it into your mouth. She spent an entire night stuffing you full of a sturdy reinforced fabric.

The reinforced fabric layer between your two folds of skin disguised the wound and protected your fabric lining. It also gave you a slightly heftier feeling, making you feel as if you were made out of real fabric and weren’t just a thin piece of skin covering Melissa’s legs. As a final bonus, it completely stopped your ability to contract. You had figured out how to move a bit too much for her liking. Thus, Melissa was especially delighted with these outcomes and congratulated you on “becoming a true skirt.”

Embarrassed, you thanked her for that compliment. She wore you to a wild party that night in celebration. After that, she never addressed you by “teach” or your real name anymore. She simply referred to you as “skirt.” You would have preferred that she call you by your real name, but you decided that you didn’t care enough to make a fuss about it. She might have sewn your mouth shut again like the last time you talked back.

After she trusted you enough, she even let you in on a few of her schemes and pranks. She would sometime surreptitiously place you in a fellow sorority sister’s closet and have you spy on them. Sometimes you would even get worn by these girls, and would get all kinds of juicy information. Melissa always extracted you and you reported to her the details.

Over this past summer, she had lamented about keeping your color up. She was tired of dying you every few months. You agreed with her; you hated that stupid bucket. You were less happy when her solution was to inject you with specialized black tattoo ink. “It will last at least 10 years!” she proclaimed.

And finally you arrived at today: the first day of classes for upper classmen. Melissa had paired you with a simple white shirt and black flats, with her hair in a loose ponytail. She wanted to look chic for the first day of school, but not dress it up too much. It was a decent combination, but you thought she could probably do better. She often chatted with you when picking out her outfit for the day, and you had learned way more about women’s fashion than you ever wanted to know.

It was the end of the first day of classes and Melissa was sitting on the couch reading her molecular biology textbook. Though you couldn’t see it, you knew Melissa was wearing reading glasses. It was odd how much she had changed in the past two years. She reminded you of that one student at the school. What was her name? Janet, you remembered. You had realized there was more to Melissa than the vapid bitch prom queen image that she played up in high school. Of course, she still had kept you captive as a mere piece of clothing for over two years. Everybody has issues, right?

Your reflections came to an end when Melissa snapped her biology textbook shut.
